name: a thought
description:
This is 'a thought', a new video game from Outhouse Media. But what about the iPhone games that were released with it?
The video game, released just over a week ago, allows you to play as the Omega, an alien race who has been revived by the Queen of the Galaxy. The games were released alongside new Jupiter-themed games, and many have been rocked by scandals. Outhouse Media's new game is called Jupiter Attack, and it's actually quite nice. The special-edition horror game can be played without the iOS app, but a few of the features of the iPhone games are available for the player to use. You can look at the game's website for more details, but a couple of features explained in the video feature the first-person ability to explore the jungle as a ship, and also some Lunar planets to explore. If you haven't already tried Jupiter Attack, you can transfer your existing ownership to the $7.99 version if you're happy to leave the app running. What you'll need: The iPhone 5. The iPhone 5S. The iPhone 5c. The Dolphin Ultra 3. The Dolphin Ultra 5. Wi-Fi internet connection. A copy of Jupiter Attack. The Dolphin Ultra 2, specially for the new Jupiter attack. To start up the app, tap the + icon on your iPhone's home screen. The app will lock your phone and ask you to
